result.execSummary:
The defendant Earl Limmuel Sanders was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.02(1)(a).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
COUNTS 1 AND 2: Provide a biological specimens for DNA analysis if not already done so. Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of ES. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.
- Restitution set in the amount of $0 (zero).

superMiscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Mental Health assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Full-time employment or part-time employment and school or full-time school.
- No Contact Order with Brittany B. AND/OR Vanessa C. AND/OR Keith B.
- No Contact Order with the adress of: 8700 West Congress, City of Milwaukee.

supervisions.notes: Court advises the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

charges.descr: Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: COUNT 1, with credit for 146 days served

records.addlTxt: Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Vanessa C. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26191712 in court 1x on 2/8/16.
Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Brittany B. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26191711 in court 1x on 2/8/16.
Request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 2/12/16 for Brittany B., Vanessa C. for 1 appearance each on 2/8/16.

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by Vanessa C., the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

As to Count 1:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  42  months, consecutive to any other sentence -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  18  months  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  24  months.

As to Count 2:
Court sentenced defendant to serve 6  MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to the sentence imposed as to Count 1;  with credit for 146 days served.

Court finds defendant is  NOT  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program  and is  NOT  eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Mental Health assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Full-time employment or part-time employment and school or full-time school
-  Court sets Restitution in the amount of $0  (zero)
-  No Contact Order with Brittany B.   AND/OR    Vanessa C.    AND/OR    Keith B.
-  No Contact Order with the address of:  8700 West Congress, City of Milwaukee
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so)
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

As to Count 1 and Count 2:
Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY  as to both counts and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored. 

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.  Jury trial is vacated.

Defendant Earl Limmuel Sanders in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Earl Limmuel Sanders in custody.  Daniel j Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Count 2:  Criminal Damage To Property (Less Than $2,500 Damage), a Class A Misdemeanor, contrary to Wisconsin State Stats. 943.01(1), 939.51(3)(a)

Defendant Earl Limmuel Sanders in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Earl Limmuel Sanders in custody.  Michael Lonski for Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Elisabeth Wallich-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KEITH B., BRITTANY B., VANESSA C.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  24 HOUR CURFEW.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Defendant subject to DRUG TESTING AND BREATHALYZER.

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
